arm_group.description: tablet-based patient education about healthy lifestyles

brief_summary.textblock:
The purpose of this study is to determine whether a multilevel mHealth intervention (mCRC)
      can increase the percentage of patients who receive colorectal cancer screening.  The mCRC
      intervention will include a tablet-based patient education program, clinic protocols to
      facilitate the ordering of CRC screening tests, and electronic messaging with patients to
      promote screening.  The investigators hypothesize that participants randomized to mCRC will
      be more likely to complete screening compared with those randomized to the control arm of
      the study.  Additionally, the investigators hypothesize mCRC will increase several
      intermediate outcomes (such as knowledge, attitudes, beliefs, and test ordering) which will
      predict completion of screening.  Lastly, the investigators hypothesize the mCRC
      intervention will add little to the overall cost of screening.

clinical_study.brief_title: Effectiveness of an mHealth Colorectal Cancer Screening Intervention

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  English-speaking patients aged 50 - 74 years

          -  Scheduled to see a primary care provider for a routine (i.e., non-urgent care) visit

          -  Due for colorectal cancer screening

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  A personal history of CRC

          -  Specific CRC risk factors, including: First degree relative with CRC; Personal
             history of adenomatous polyps; Personal history of inflammatory bowel disease; Recent
             blood in stools

          -  Obvious physical or mental disability that would prevent participant from interacting
             with a tablet device.

intervention.description: a multilevel intervention consisting of tablet-based patient education about CRC screening, post-visit patient electronic messaging, and clinic protocols to facilitate ordering of screening tests
a brief video about healthy lifestyle habits displayed on a tablet device

clinical_study.official_title: A Primary Care Multilevel mHealth Colorectal Cancer Screening (mCRC) Intervention

primary_outcome.description: Patient completion of a colorectal cancer screening test, such as the fecal occult blood test, a flexible sigmoidoscopy, or a colonoscopy.

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

secondary_outcome.description: A survey scale measuring the participant's attitudes and beliefs about CRC screening
Participant's stated intention to receive CRC screening
Participant's belief that they are capable of completing CRC screening

secondary_outcome.measure: Ability to make a screening decision

secondary_outcome.description: Participants' self-report of whether they discussed CRC screening with a medical provider
Survey questions based on the Satisfaction with Decision Scale
Whether or not a CRC screening test was ordered for the participant
Additional cost of the mCRC intervention as captured by additional time and technology costs
Participant's rating of the usability of the mCRC system

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Randomized, Endpoint Classification: Efficacy Study, Intervention Model: Parallel Assignment, Masking: Single Blind (Investigator), Primary Purpose: Health Services Research
